frontmatter.title: Rails 7 adds support for deferrable foreign key constraints in PostgreSQL
frontmatter.description: By default, foreign key constraints in PostgreSQL are checked after each statement. This works for most use cases but becomes a major limitation when creating related records before the parent record is inserted into the database.

frontmatter.title: Rails 7 adds optional transaction arguments to with_lock
frontmatter.description: With Rails 7 we can pass transaction arguments like isolation, joinable, etc directly to with_lock.

frontmatter.title: React State management - Part 2
frontmatter.description: Learn some of the inherent ways of managing state without using any external state management tool.

frontmatter.title: Using Amazon Personalize to create a Recommendation System
frontmatter.description: A Step-By-Step Guide to Building a Recommender System using Amazon Personalize with its Similar-Items Recipe.

frontmatter.title: Rails 7 adds caching? and uncachable! helper
frontmatter.description: Starting with Rails 7, we can add caching? helper to check whether the current code path is being cached and uncacheable! helper to avoid fragment caching.

frontmatter.title: Different ways to handle state in React applications
frontmatter.description: Sometimes, it is better not to use any external state management tool unless our application is that complex.  We can avoid complexities involved in state management using some of the inherent ways.
